doc.after: Originally, the rocks in which Carnotaurus was found were assigned to the upper part of the Gorro Frigio Formation, which was considered to be approximately 100 million years old (Albian or Cenomanian stage).[29][AS] Later they were realized to pertain to the much younger La Colonia Formation,[33] dating 72 to 69.9 million years ago (Late Cretaceous, Lower Maastrichtian stage).[AT] Thus, Carnotaurus was the latest South American abelisaurid known.[14] By the Late Cretaceous, South America was already isolated from both Africa and North America.[36]
